Problem:
We consider a dual-space system where two functions are defined: \\( f(x) = \int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-st} x(t) \, dt \\) (Laplace Transform) and \\( g(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-2\pi i t x} \, dt \\) (Fourier Transform). Let \\( x(t) \\) represent an input signal evolving over time.

Having the result of \\( f(x) \\) at hand, can it always be exclusively determined whether this result was obtained solely by the Laplace transform without any pre-computation based modifications on \\( x(t) \\)?
Explanation: The presence of similar transformations in output, similar to an Inverse Laplace condition, might confuse the identification process unless additional information about the initial conditions or the system's nature is provided.
